TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SyndicationFeed extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a top-level feed object, <> in Atom 1.0 and <> in RSS 2.0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, a SyndicationFeed instance is written to a <`feed`> element. The following table shows how each property defined in the SyndicationFeed class is serialized to Atom 1.0.
|SyndicationFeed property|Serialized form| |------------------------------|---------------------| |`AttributeExtensions`|An attribute in the <`feed`> element for each attribute in the collection.| |`Authors`|An <`author`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the collection.| |`Categories`|A <`category`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> in the collection.| |`Contributors`|A <`contributor`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the collection.| |`Copyright`|A <`rights`> element.| |`Description`|A <`subtitle`> element.| |`ElementExtensions`|Each element in the collection is written within the <`feed`> element.| |`Generator`|A <`generator`> element.| |`Id`|An <`id`>element.| |`ImageUri`|A <`logo`> element.| |`Items`|An <`entry`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> in the collection.| |`Language`|Not serialized.| |`LastUpdatedTime`|An <`updated`> element.| |`Links`|A <`link`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> in the collection.| |`Title`|A <`title`> element.|
When serialized to RSS 2.0, a SyndicationFeed instance is written to an <`rss`> element. The following table shows how each property defined in the SyndicationFeed class is serialized to RSS 2.0.
|SyndicationFeed property|Serialized form| |------------------------------|---------------------| |`AttributeExtensions`|An attribute in the <`channel`> element for each attribute in the collection.| |`Authors`|A <`managingEditor`> element if only one <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> is in the collection; otherwise, an <`a10:author`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the collection.| |`Categories`|A <`category`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> in the collection.| |`Contributors`|An <`a10:contributor`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the collection.| |`Copyright`|A <`copyright`> element.| |`Description`|A <`description`> element.| |`ElementExtensions`|Each element in the collection is written within the <`channel`> element.| |`Generator`|A <`generator`> element.| |`Id`|An <`a10:id`> element.| |`ImageUri`|An <`image`> element.| |`Items`|An <`item`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> in the collection.| |`Language`|A <`language`> element.| |`LastUpdatedTime`|A <`lastBuildDate`> element.| |`Links`|An <`a10:link`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> in the collection.| |`Title`|A <`title`> element.|
## Examples The following code shows how to create a SyndicationFeed instance and serialize it to both Atom 1.0 and RSS 2.0.
[!code-vb[SyndicationFeed#0](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.servicemodel.sy_12_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SyndicationFeed#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.servicemodel.sy_12_1.cs)]
The following XML shows how a SyndicationFeed is serialized to Atom 1.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationFeed#1](~/add/codesnippet/xml/t-system.servicemodel.sy_12_2.xml)]
The following XML shows how a SyndicationFeed instance is serialized to RSS 2.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationFeed#2](~/add/codesnippet/xml/t-system.servicemodel.sy_12_3.xml)]

## Examples The following example demonstrates how to call this constructor.
[!code-vb[SyndicationFeed#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/11a0715f-75c3-489c-86f3-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SyndicationFeed#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/11a0715f-75c3-489c-86f3-_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed source, bool cloneItems) cil managed

Docs.param: The used to initialize the new instance.
A value that specifies whether to clone the items in the source instance.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified feed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the `cloneItems` parameter is `true`, all <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instances in the source <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance are cloned and added to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Items%2A> collection of the new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance. If the `cloneItems` parameter is `false`, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Items%2A> collection of the new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance contains references to the existing <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instances.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of attribute extensions.
Docs.value: A dictionary that contains a collection of attribute extensions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An attribute extension is a valid XML attribute that is not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. When serialized to Atom 1.0, each custom attribute in the collection is written to the <`atom`> element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, each custom attribute is written to the <`channel`> element. [!INCLUDE[crexample](~/add/includes/crexample-md.md)] adding an attribute extension, see the [Loosely-Typed Extensions](../Topic/Loosely-Typed%20Extensions%20Sample.md) sample.
## Examples The following code shows how to add an attribute extension to a syndication feed.
[!code-cs[LooselyTypedExtensions#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_20_1.cs)] [!code-vb[LooselyTypedExtensions#0](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_20_1.vb)]
The following XML shows how an attribute extension is serialized to Atom 1.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationFeed#14](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_20_2.xml)]
The following XML shows how an attribute extension is serialized to RSS 2.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationFeed#15](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_20_3.xml)]

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of authors of the feed.
Docs.value: A collection of objects that represents the authors of the feed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the collection is written to an <`author`> element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, if only a single <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> exists in the collection, it is written to a <`managingEditor`> element. Otherwise, each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> is written to an <`a10:author`> element.
## Examples The following code shows how to add an author to the Authors collection of a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed>.
[!code-vb[SyndicationFeed#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_31_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SyndicationFeed#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_31_1.cs)]
The following XML shows how the Authors collection is serialized to Atom 1.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationFeed#16](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_31_2.xml)]
The following XML shows how the Authors collection is serialized to RSS 2.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationFeed#17](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_31_3.xml)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed Clone(bool cloneItems) cil managed

Docs.param: A value that specifies whether the objects are cloned.
Docs.summary: Creates a copy of the instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the `cloneItems` parameter is `true`, all items within the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> object are cloned; otherwise, the new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance's items collection contain references to the original <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance's items.
## Examples The following code shows how to call this method.

Docs.summary: Gets and sets copyright information for the feed.
Docs.value: A object that represents copyright information for the feed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, the Copyright is written to a <`rights`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the Copyright is written to a <`copyright`> element.
## Examples The following code shows how to set the copyright information for a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed>.

The following XML shows how the Copyright is serialized to RSS 2.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationFeed#23](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_37_3.xml)]

When serialized to RSS 2.0, Description is written to a <`description`> element.

Docs.summary: Gets the element extensions for the feed.
Docs.value: A instance that contains the element extensions in the feed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.
`<mg:MyElement xmlns:mg="http://myserver/elements" />`
[!INCLUDE[crexample](~/add/includes/crexample-md.md)] adding element extensions, see the [Loosely-Typed Extensions](../Topic/Loosely-Typed%20Extensions%20Sample.md) sample.
## Examples The following code shows how to add element extensions to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance.
[!code-cs[LooselyTypedExtensions#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[LooselyTypedExtensions#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_3_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the generator of the feed.
Docs.value: The name of the tool that generated the feed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0 and RSS 2.0, the Generator is written to a <`generator`> element.
## Examples The following code shows how to set the Generator of a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed>.
[!code-xml[SyndicationFeed#39](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_17_1.xml)] [!code-vb[SyndicationFeed#39](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_17_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SyndicationFeed#39](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_17_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter GetAtom10Formatter() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20FeedFormatter GetRss20Formatter() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20FeedFormatter GetRss20Formatter(bool serializeExtensionsAsAtom) cil managed

Docs.param: A value that specifies whether to serialize element and attribute extensions with an Atom 1.0 namespace.
Docs.summary: Gets a new instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The RSS 2.0 specification allows elements and attributes that are not specified in its specification only if they are within a namespace. When the `serializedExtensionsAsAtom` parameter is `true`, the formatter automatically adds the `a10` namespace qualifier to all extensions; otherwise, the extensions are not serialized.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, the Id is written to an <`a10:id`> element.

Docs.value: The URL for the image for the feed.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, the ImageUrl property is written to an <`image`> element.

remarks.format:

When serialized to Atom 1.0, the Items collection is written to <`item`> elements.

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the language of the feed.
Docs.value: The name of the language the feed is written in.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, the Language property is written to the `lang` attribute in the <`feed`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the Language property is written to the <`language`> element.
## Examples The following code shows how to set the Language property on a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance.
[!code-vb[SyndicationFeed#43](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_34_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SyndicationFeed#43](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_34_1.cs)]

[!code-xml[SyndicationFeed#33](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_34_3.xml)]

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the time the feed was last updated.
Docs.value: A instance set to the time the feed was last updated.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, the LastUpdatedTime property is written to an <`updated`>element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the LastUpdatedTime property is written to a <`lastBuildDate`> element.
## Examples The following code shows how to se the LastUpdatedTime property on a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance.

Docs.summary: Gets the links associated with the feed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, the Links collection is written to a number of <`link`> elements.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the Links collection is written to a number of <`a10:link`> elements.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual bool TryParseAttribute (string name, string ns, string value, string version);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryParseAttribute(string name, string ns, string value, string version) cil managed

Docs.param: The syndication version to use when parsing.
Docs.summary: Attempts to parse an attribute extension.
Docs.returns: A value that specifies whether the attribute extension was parsed successfully.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the <`feed`> (for Atom 1.0) or <`rss`> (for RSS 1.0) element, which depends upon the syndication version being used. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom attribute extension. To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual bool TryParseElement (System.Xml.XmlReader reader, string version);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryParseElement(class System.Xml.XmlReader reader, string version) cil managed

Docs.param: The syndication version to use while parsing.
Docs.summary: Attempts to parse an element extension.
Docs.returns: A value that specifies whether the element extension was parsed successfully.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom element extension. To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.

Docs.summary: Writes the attribute extensions to the specified using the specified syndication version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the <`feed`> (for Atom 1.0) or <`rss`> (for RSS 1.0) element, which depends upon the syndication version being used. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom attribute extensions. To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom element extensions. To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.
